prompt: Find the IDs of all students who have taken both Course ID 102 and Course ID 105.
sql_statement: SELECT Students_Id  FROM mydb_StudentsCourses  WHERE Courses_Id = 102  INTERSECT  SELECT Students_Id  FROM mydb_StudentsCourses  WHERE Courses_Id = 105;
schema: CREATE TABLE mydb_ProfessorsCourses (   Professors_Id Int NOT NULL,   Courses_Id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE mydb_StudentsCourses (   Students_Id BigInt NOT NULL,   Courses_Id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE mydb_TitlesProfessors (   Professors_Id Int NOT NULL,   Titles_Id Int NOT NULL );

prompt: What are the names of the APIs that have been associated with at least one version?
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT T1.name AS api_name  FROM apis AS T1  JOIN histories AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.api_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE versions (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   major Integer NOT NULL,   minor Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE apis (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE histories (   api_id Integer NOT NULL,   version_id Integer NOT NULL,   status Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (api_id, version_id, status),   FOREIGN KEY (api_id) REFERENCES apis (id),   FOREIGN KEY (version_id) REFERENCES versions (id) );

prompt: List all the versions where both major and minor numbers are greater than 0.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "name" FROM "versions" WHERE "major" > 0 AND "minor" > 0;
schema: CREATE TABLE versions (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   major Integer NOT NULL,   minor Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE apis (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE histories (   api_id Integer NOT NULL,   version_id Integer NOT NULL,   status Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (api_id, version_id, status),   FOREIGN KEY (api_id) REFERENCES apis (id),   FOREIGN KEY (version_id) REFERENCES versions (id) );

prompt: Which API has the most number of historical entries in the histories table?
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT api.name AS api_name  FROM histories  JOIN apis ON histories.api_id = apis.id  GROUP BY api_id  ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE versions (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   major Integer NOT NULL,   minor Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE apis (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE histories (   api_id Integer NOT NULL,   version_id Integer NOT NULL,   status Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (api_id, version_id, status),   FOREIGN KEY (api_id) REFERENCES apis (id),   FOREIGN KEY (version_id) REFERENCES versions (id) );

prompt: What is the status of the latest version for each API?
sql_statement: SELECT      a.name AS api_name,     v.major AS major_version,     v.minor AS minor_version,     h.status AS latest_status FROM      apis a JOIN      histories h ON a.id = h.api_id JOIN      versions v ON h.version_id = v.id WHERE      (a.id, h.version_id) IN (         SELECT api_id, MAX(version_id)         FROM histories         GROUP BY api_id     );
schema: CREATE TABLE versions (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   major Integer NOT NULL,   minor Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE apis (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE histories (   api_id Integer NOT NULL,   version_id Integer NOT NULL,   status Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (api_id, version_id, status),   FOREIGN KEY (api_id) REFERENCES apis (id),   FOREIGN KEY (version_id) REFERENCES versions (id) );

prompt: Find the version with the highest sum of major and minor numbers.
sql_statement: SELECT name FROM versions  ORDER BY major + minor DESC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE versions (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   major Integer NOT NULL,   minor Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE apis (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE histories (   api_id Integer NOT NULL,   version_id Integer NOT NULL,   status Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (api_id, version_id, status),   FOREIGN KEY (api_id) REFERENCES apis (id),   FOREIGN KEY (version_id) REFERENCES versions (id) );

prompt: List all APIs that have been associated with more than one version.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT a.name AS api_name FROM apis a JOIN histories h ON a.id = h.api_id GROUP BY h.api_id HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT h.version_id) > 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE versions (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   major Integer NOT NULL,   minor Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE apis (   id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Text NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE histories (   api_id Integer NOT NULL,   version_id Integer NOT NULL,   status Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (api_id, version_id, status),   FOREIGN KEY (api_id) REFERENCES apis (id),   FOREIGN KEY (version_id) REFERENCES versions (id) );

prompt: Identify the name of the API with the highest number of historical entries with a status of 1.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "name" FROM "apis" WHERE "id" = (     SELECT "api_id" FROM "histories" WHERE "status" = 1 GROUP BY "api_id" ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1 );

prompt: Please list the names of all versions where the major number is even and the minor number is odd.

prompt: 1. How many novels are marked as favorite in the default_novels table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS favorite_novels_count  FROM default_novels  WHERE favorite = TRUE;
schema: CREATE TABLE default_novels (   id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   feed_url Varchar NOT NULL,   image_url Varchar NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL,   favorite BOOL NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE novels (   novel_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   user_id Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   image_url Varchar NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL,   favorite BOOL NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (novel_id) );  CREATE TABLE feeds (   feed_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   novel_id Varchar NOT NULL,   feed_url Varchar NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (feed_id) );  CREATE TABLE notifications (   notification_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   feed_id Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   link Varchar NOT NULL,   pub_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (notification_id) );  CREATE TABLE tokens (   user_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   refresh_token Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (user_id) );

prompt: 9. Find the notification with the earliest pub_date and provide its title and link.
sql_statement: SELECT title, link  FROM notifications  ORDER BY pub_date ASC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE default_novels (   id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   feed_url Varchar NOT NULL,   image_url Varchar NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL,   favorite BOOL NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE novels (   novel_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   user_id Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   image_url Varchar NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL,   favorite BOOL NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (novel_id) );  CREATE TABLE feeds (   feed_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   novel_id Varchar NOT NULL,   feed_url Varchar NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (feed_id) );  CREATE TABLE notifications (   notification_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   feed_id Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   link Varchar NOT NULL,   pub_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (notification_id) );  CREATE TABLE tokens (   user_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   refresh_token Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (user_id) );

prompt: 10. How many feeds have a feed_url that matches 'http://example.com/feed/%' pattern?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS feed_count  FROM feeds  WHERE feed_url LIKE 'http://example.com/feed/%';
schema: CREATE TABLE default_novels (   id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   feed_url Varchar NOT NULL,   image_url Varchar NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL,   favorite BOOL NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE novels (   novel_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   user_id Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   image_url Varchar NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL,   favorite BOOL NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (novel_id) );  CREATE TABLE feeds (   feed_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   novel_id Varchar NOT NULL,   feed_url Varchar NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (feed_id) );  CREATE TABLE notifications (   notification_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   feed_id Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   link Varchar NOT NULL,   pub_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (notification_id) );  CREATE TABLE tokens (   user_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   refresh_token Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (user_id) );

prompt: How many campaigns are there that feature products with a price greater than $100?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT campaign.id) AS campaign_count  FROM campaign  JOIN product ON campaign.product_id = product.id  WHERE CAST(product.price AS REAL) > 100;
schema: CREATE TABLE campaign (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   product_id TEXT NOT NULL,   picture Varchar NOT NULL,   story Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES product (id) );  CREATE TABLE hot (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE hot_product (   hot_id TEXT NOT NULL,   product_id TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (hot_id, product_id),   FOREIGN KEY (hot_id) REFERENCES hot (id),   FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES product (id) );  CREATE TABLE order_table (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   number Varchar NOT NULL,   time TEXT NOT NULL,   status TinyInt NOT NULL,   details TEXT NOT NULL,   user_id TEXT NOT NULL,   total Float NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES user (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE payment (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   order_id TEXT NOT NULL,   details TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (order_id) REFERENCES order_table (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE product (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   category Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   description Varchar NOT NULL,   price TEXT NOT NULL,   texture Varchar NOT NULL,   wash Varchar NOT NULL,   place Varchar NOT NULL,   note Varchar NOT NULL,   story Text NOT NULL,   main_image Varchar NOT NULL,   images Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE role (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE user (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   role_id TEXT NOT NULL,   provider Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   picture Varchar NOT NULL,   access_token Varchar NOT NULL,   access_expired TEXT NOT NULL,   login_at Timestamp,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES role (id) );  CREATE TABLE variant (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   color_code Varchar NOT NULL,   color_name Varchar NOT NULL,   size Varchar NOT NULL,   stock TEXT NOT NULL,   product_id TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES product (id) );

prompt: What is the total number of unique hot products listed in the hot_product table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT "product_id") AS "unique_hot_products_count" FROM hot_product;

prompt: Calculate the average time taken for orders to be processed (from order creation to payment).
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(strftime('%s', p.details) - strftime('%s', o.time)) AS average_processing_time_seconds FROM order_table o JOIN payment p ON o.id = p.order_id;

prompt: How many users have made more than 5 successful payments in the past year?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS num_users  FROM payment  JOIN order_table ON payment.order_id = order_table.id  WHERE order_table.status = 1 AND order_table.time >= DATE('now','-1 year') GROUP BY user_id  HAVING COUNT(order_id) > 5;

prompt: Find the product title and description for the product with the highest total sales amount.
sql_statement: SELECT      p.title AS Product_Title,      p.description AS Product_Description FROM      product p JOIN      order_table o ON p.id = (SELECT product_id FROM variant WHERE id IN (SELECT details FROM payment)) GROUP BY      p.id ORDER BY      SUM(o.total) DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: Which role has the most number of users assigned to it?
sql_statement: SELECT role.name AS role_name, COUNT(user.id) AS user_count  FROM role  JOIN user ON role.id = user.role_id  GROUP BY role.name  ORDER BY user_count DESC  LIMIT 1;

prompt: What is the total stock available for each color variant of a specific product (e.g., product ID 'abc123')?
sql_statement: SELECT      color_name,      SUM(stock::INTEGER) AS total_stock FROM      variant WHERE      product_id = 'abc123' GROUP BY      color_name;

prompt: How many orders were placed by users who have logged in more than 5 times this month?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT ot.id) AS order_count FROM order_table ot JOIN user u ON ot.user_id = u.id WHERE u.login_at >= DATE('now', '-1 month') GROUP BY u.id HAVING COUNT(u.login_at) > 5;

prompt: Calculate the difference between the maximum and minimum prices of products in the 'Clothing' category.
sql_statement: SELECT      MAX(CAST(price AS REAL)) - MIN(CAST(price AS REAL)) AS price_difference FROM      product WHERE      category = 'Clothing';

prompt: What is the total number of records in the public_param_newbase table where the scale is greater than 1.5?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_records  FROM "public_param_newbase"  WHERE scale > 1.5;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Which producer has the highest average base value across all their records in the table?
sql_statement: SELECT producer_id, AVG(base) AS average_base_value  FROM public_param_newbase  GROUP BY producer_id  ORDER BY average_base_value DESC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Find the last_updater and the latest last_updated timestamp for a record with a specific param_id (e.g., param_id = 42).
sql_statement: SELECT      "last_updater",      MAX("last_updated") AS "latest_last_updated" FROM      "public_param_newbase" WHERE      "param_id" = 42;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Calculate the difference between the maximum and minimum values of the 'base' column for each unique univ_id.
sql_statement: SELECT      univ_id,      MAX(base) - MIN(base) AS base_difference FROM      public_param_newbase GROUP BY      univ_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: How many distinct producer_ids are present in the public_param_newbase table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT producer_id) AS distinct_producer_count  FROM public_param_newbase;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the average scale value for records where the base value is less than 10?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(scale) AS average_scale FROM public_param_newbase WHERE base < 10;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: List all the unique last_updater names along with the count of records they have updated in descending order.
sql_statement: SELECT      "last_updater",      COUNT(*) AS "update_count" FROM      public_param_newbase GROUP BY      "last_updater" ORDER BY      "update_count" DESC;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Find the record with the earliest last_updated timestamp and provide its id, producer_id, and param_id.
sql_statement: SELECT id, producer_id, param_id  FROM public_param_newbase  ORDER BY last_updated ASC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: How many times has a specific univ_id (e.g., univ_id = 789) appeared in the public_param_newbase table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS "count_of_univ_id_789"  FROM public_param_newbase  WHERE univ_id = 789;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Which producer has the most records where the scale value is between 2.0 and 3.0 inclusive?
sql_statement: SELECT producer_id, COUNT(*) AS record_count  FROM public_param_newbase  WHERE scale BETWEEN 2.0 AND 3.0  GROUP BY producer_id  ORDER BY record_count DESC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE public_param_newbase (   id Integer NOT NULL,   producer_id Integer NOT NULL,   param_id Integer NOT NULL,   univ_id Integer NOT NULL,   scale Numeric NOT NULL,   base Numeric NOT NULL,   last_updater Text NOT NULL,   last_updated Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: List the titles of movies directed by "Christopher Nolan".
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "title" FROM "movies" WHERE "director" = 'Christopher Nolan';
schema: CREATE TABLE movies (   id_movie Numeric NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   director Varchar NOT NULL,   copies Numeric NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id_movie) );  CREATE TABLE clients (   id_client Numeric NOT NULL UNIQUE,   client_name Varchar NOT NULL,   client_pass Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id_client) );  CREATE TABLE rents (   id_rent Numeric NOT NULL UNIQUE,   numeric_movies Numeric NOT NULL,   devolution_date Datetime NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id_rent) );

prompt: What is the total number of copies available for all movies combined?
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(copies) AS total_copies FROM movies;

prompt: List the names and emails of all clients who have rented more than 5 movies.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT c.client_name, c.email  FROM clients c  JOIN rents r ON c.id_client = r.numeric_movies  GROUP BY c.id_client  HAVING COUNT(r.id_rent) > 5;

prompt: Find the client(s) who have rented the most movies.

prompt: List the movies that were rented after January 1, 2023, and order them by their titles.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT m.title  FROM movies m  JOIN rents r ON m.id_movie = r.numeric_movies  WHERE r.devolution_date > '2023-01-01'  ORDER BY m.title;

prompt: How many tables are managed by COMTECOPSEQ?

schema: CREATE TABLE COMTECOPSEQ (   TABLE_NAME TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   NEXT_ID TEXT,   PRIMARY KEY (TABLE_NAME) );  CREATE TABLE COMTCCMMNCLCODE (   CL_CODE Char NOT NULL UNIQUE,   CL_CODE_NM TEXT,   CL_CODE_DC TEXT,   USE_AT Char,   FRST_REGIST_PNTTM Date,   FRST_REGISTER_ID TEXT,   LAST_UPDT_PNTTM Date,   LAST_UPDUSR_ID TEXT,   PRIMARY KEY (CL_CODE) );  CREATE TABLE COMTNFILE (   ATCH_FILE_ID Char NOT NULL UNIQUE,   CREAT_DT Date NOT NULL,   USE_AT Char,   PRIMARY KEY (ATCH_FILE_ID) );  CREATE TABLE COMTNFILEDETAIL (   ATCH_FILE_ID Char NOT NULL,   FILE_SN TEXT NOT NULL,   FILE_STRE_COURS TEXT NOT NULL,   STRE_FILE_NM TEXT NOT NULL,   ORIGNL_FILE_NM TEXT,   FILE_EXTSN TEXT NOT NULL,   FILE_CN Clob,   FILE_SIZE TEXT,   PRIMARY KEY (ATCH_FILE_ID, FILE_SN),   FOREIGN KEY (ATCH_FILE_ID) REFERENCES COMTNFILE (ATCH_FILE_ID) );  CREATE TABLE COMTHEMAILDSPTCHMANAGE (   MSSAGE_ID TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   EMAIL_CN Clob,   SNDR TEXT NOT NULL,   RCVER TEXT NOT NULL,   SJ TEXT NOT NULL,   SNDNG_RESULT_CODE Char,   DSPTCH_DT Char NOT NULL,   ATCH_FILE_ID Char,   PRIMARY KEY (MSSAGE_ID),   FOREIGN KEY (ATCH_FILE_ID) REFERENCES COMTNFILE (ATCH_FILE_ID) );  CREATE TABLE COMTNROLEINFO (   ROLE_CODE TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   ROLE_NM TEXT NOT NULL,   ROLE_PTTRN TEXT,   ROLE_DC TEXT,   ROLE_TY TEXT,   ROLE_SORT TEXT,   ROLE_CREAT_DE Char NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (ROLE_CODE) );  CREATE TABLE IDS (   IDGEN_TABLE_NM TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   IDGEN_NEXT_ID TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (IDGEN_TABLE_NM) );  CREATE TABLE COMTNRESTDE (   RESTDE_NO TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   RESTDE Char,   RESTDE_NM TEXT,   RESTDE_DC TEXT,   RESTDE_SE_CODE TEXT,   FRST_REGIST_PNTTM Date,   FRST_REGISTER_ID TEXT,   LAST_UPDT_PNTTM Date,   LAST_UPDUSR_ID TEXT,   PRIMARY KEY (RESTDE_NO) ); prompt: Retrieve the names and descriptions of all common classification codes (COMTCCMMNCLCODE) that were first registered before January 1, 2020.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "CL_CODE_NM", "CL_CODE_DC"  FROM COMTCCMMNCLCODE  WHERE "FRST_REGIST_PNTTM" < '2020-01-01';

prompt: How many successful migrations have been recorded in the public__sqlx_migrations table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS successful_migrations_count  FROM public__sqlx_migrations  WHERE success = TRUE;
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: List all the shares that were created after January 1, 2023.
sql_statement: SELECT "id", "name", "created_at"  FROM "public_shares"  WHERE "created_at" > '2023-01-01';
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the average execution time of all failed migrations?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(execution_time) AS average_execution_time FROM public__sqlx_migrations WHERE success = FALSE;
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Find the total number of schemas associated with more than one share.
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT schema_id) AS total_schemas_with_multiple_shares FROM public_schemas GROUP BY schema_id HAVING COUNT(share_id) > 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: Provide the names and creation dates of tables located in a specific directory ('/path/to/directory').
sql_statement: SELECT      name AS "Table Name",      created_at AS "Creation Date"  FROM      public_tables  WHERE      location = '/path/to/directory';
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: How many unique tokens have been created in the last month?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT "id") AS unique_tokens_count  FROM public_tokens  WHERE "created_at" >= DATE('now', '-1 month');
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: List all token IDs that are associated with more than 5 tables.
sql_statement: SELECT token_id  FROM public_tokens_for_tables  GROUP BY token_id  HAVING COUNT(table_id) > 5;
schema: CREATE TABLE public__sqlx_migrations (   version BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   installed_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   success Boolean NOT NULL,   checksum TEXT NOT NULL,   execution_time BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_schemas (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   share_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_shares (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL,   schema_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   location Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token Text NOT NULL,   expires_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE public_tokens_for_tables (   id TEXT NOT NULL,   token_id TEXT NOT NULL,   table_id TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the percentage of shares that do not have any associated schemas?
sql_statement: SELECT      CAST(COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN schema_id IS NULL THEN share_id END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(DISTINCT share_id) AS percentage_no_schema FROM      public_shares LEFT JOIN      public_tables ON public_shares.id = public_tables.schema_id;

prompt: Among the tables, which ones have 'data' in their location path?
sql_statement: SELECT "name" FROM "public_tables" WHERE "location" LIKE '%data%';

prompt: Find the schema name and its corresponding share ID where the table 'sales_data' is located.
sql_statement: SELECT      s.name AS schema_name,      s.share_id AS share_id FROM      public_schemas s JOIN      public_tables t ON s.id = t.schema_id WHERE      t.name = 'sales_data';

prompt: What is the total number of unique tables managed by the COMTECOPSEQ table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT TABLE_NAME) AS unique_tables_count FROM COMTECOPSEQ;
schema: CREATE TABLE COMTECOPSEQ (   TABLE_NAME TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   NEXT_ID TEXT,   PRIMARY KEY (TABLE_NAME) );  CREATE TABLE COMTCCMMNCLCODE (   CL_CODE Char NOT NULL UNIQUE,   CL_CODE_NM TEXT,   CL_CODE_DC TEXT,   USE_AT Char,   FRST_REGIST_PNTTM Date,   FRST_REGISTER_ID TEXT,   LAST_UPDT_PNTTM Date,   LAST_UPDUSR_ID TEXT,   PRIMARY KEY (CL_CODE) );  CREATE TABLE COMTHEMAILDSPTCHMANAGE (   MSSAGE_ID TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   EMAIL_CN Clob,   SNDR TEXT NOT NULL,   RCVER TEXT NOT NULL,   SJ TEXT NOT NULL,   SNDNG_RESULT_CODE Char,   DSPTCH_DT Char NOT NULL,   ATCH_FILE_ID Char,   PRIMARY KEY (MSSAGE_ID),   FOREIGN KEY (ATCH_FILE_ID) REFERENCES COMTNFILE (ATCH_FILE_ID) ON DELETE SET NULL );  CREATE TABLE COMTNEMPLYRINFO (   EMPLYR_ID TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   ORGNZT_ID Char,   USER_NM TEXT NOT NULL,   PASSWORD TEXT NOT NULL,   EMPL_NO TEXT,   IHIDNUM TEXT,   SEXDSTN_CODE Char,   BRTHDY Char,   FXNUM TEXT,   HOUSE_ADRES TEXT NOT NULL,   PASSWORD_HINT TEXT NOT NULL,   PASSWORD_CNSR TEXT NOT NULL,   HOUSE_END_TELNO TEXT NOT NULL,   AREA_NO TEXT NOT NULL,   DETAIL_ADRES TEXT,   ZIP TEXT NOT NULL,   OFFM_TELNO TEXT,   MBTLNUM TEXT,   EMAIL_ADRES TEXT,   OFCPS_NM TEXT,   HOUSE_MIDDLE_TELNO TEXT NOT NULL,   GROUP_ID Char,   PSTINST_CODE Char,   EMPLYR_STTUS_CODE Char NOT NULL,   ESNTL_ID Char NOT NULL,   CRTFC_DN_VALUE TEXT,   SBSCRB_DE Date,   LOCK_AT Char,   LOCK_CNT TEXT,   LOCK_LAST_PNTTM Date,   CHG_PWD_LAST_PNTTM Date,   PRIMARY KEY (EMPLYR_ID),   FOREIGN KEY (ORGNZT_ID) REFERENCES COMTNORGNZTINFO (ORGNZT_ID) ON DELETE CASCADE,   FOREIGN KEY (GROUP_ID) REFERENCES COMTNAUTHORGROUPINFO (GROUP_ID) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE COMTNENTRPRSMBER (   ENTRPRS_MBER_ID TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   ENTRPRS_SE_CODE Char,   BIZRNO TEXT,   JURIRNO TEXT,   CMPNY_NM TEXT NOT NULL,   CXFC TEXT,   ZIP TEXT NOT NULL,   ADRES TEXT NOT NULL,   ENTRPRS_MIDDLE_TELNO TEXT NOT NULL,   FXNUM TEXT,   INDUTY_CODE Char,   APPLCNT_NM TEXT NOT NULL,   APPLCNT_IHIDNUM TEXT,   SBSCRB_DE Date,   ENTRPRS_MBER_STTUS TEXT,   ENTRPRS_MBER_PASSWORD TEXT,   ENTRPRS_MBER_PASSWORD_HINT TEXT NOT NULL,   ENTRPRS_MBER_PASSWORD_CNSR TEXT NOT NULL,   GROUP_ID Char,   DETAIL_ADRES TEXT,   ENTRPRS_END_TELNO TEXT NOT NULL,   AREA_NO TEXT NOT NULL,   APPLCNT_EMAIL_ADRES TEXT NOT NULL,   ESNTL_ID Char NOT NULL,   LOCK_AT Char,   LOCK_CNT TEXT,   LOCK_LAST_PNTTM Date,   CHG_PWD_LAST_PNTTM Date,   PRIMARY KEY (ENTRPRS_MBER_ID),   FOREIGN KEY (GROUP_ID) REFERENCES COMTNAUTHORGROUPINFO (GROUP_ID) ON DELETE CASCADE ); prompt: List the names and descriptions of all codes in the COMTCCMMNCODE table that belong to a specific category (e.g., CL_CODE = '01').
sql_statement: SELECT "CODE_ID_NM", "CODE_ID_DC" FROM COMTCCMMNCODE WHERE CL_CODE = '01';

prompt: Retrieve the file paths and sizes for all files attached in emails sent on a specific date (e.g., DSPTCH_DT = '2023-01-01') from the COMTHEMAILDSPTCHMANAGE table.
sql_statement: SELECT      f.FILE_STRE_COURS || '/' || f.STRE_FILE_NM AS file_path,     f.FILE_SIZE FROM      COMTHEMAILDSPTCHMANAGE ed JOIN      COMTNFILEDETAIL f ON ed.ATCH_FILE_ID = f.ATCH_FILE_ID WHERE      ed.DSPTCH_DT = '2023-01-01';

prompt: Count the number of users who have subscribed after January 1, 2022, and are part of the 'Admin' group in the COMTNGNRLMBER table.
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS user_count  FROM COMTNGNRLMBER  WHERE GROUP_ID = 'Admin' AND SBSCRB_DE > '2022-01-01';

prompt: Find the average age of employees based on their birthdates in the COMTNEMPLYRINFO table.
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(CAST(strftime('%Y', 'now') - strftime('%Y', BRTHDY) - (strftime('%m-%d', 'now') < strftime('%m-%d', BRTHDY)) AS REAL)) AS average_age FROM COMTNEMPLYRINFO;

prompt: List all the questions and their corresponding types from the COMTNQUSTNRQESITM table for a specific questionnaire template (e.g., QUSTNR_TMPLAT_ID = '12345').
sql_statement: SELECT QESTN_CN AS Question, QESTN_TY_CODE AS Type  FROM COMTNQUSTNRQESITM  WHERE QUSTNR_TMPLAT_ID = '12345';

prompt: Determine the most common role type (ROLE_TY) among users in the COMTNAUTHORROLERELATE table.
sql_statement: SELECT ROLE_TY  FROM COMTNAUTHORROLERELATE  JOIN COMTNROLEINFO ON COMTNAUTHORROLERELATE.ROLE_CODE = COMTNROLEINFO.ROLE_CODE  GROUP BY ROLE_TY  ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC  LIMIT 1;

prompt: Calculate the total number of distinct email addresses in the COMTNENTRPRSMBER table that belong to companies with a specific industry code (e.g., INDUTY_CODE = 'A01').
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT "APPLCNT_EMAIL_ADRES") AS "distinct_email_count"  FROM COMTNENTRPRSMBER  WHERE INDUTY_CODE = 'A01';

prompt: Identify the names and contact information of all employees who have won awards or recognitions as indicated by their status code in the COMTNEMPLYRINFO table.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "USER_NM", "MBTLNUM", "EMAIL_ADRES"  FROM COMTNEMPLYRINFO  WHERE "EMPLYR_STTUS_CODE" IN ('A1', 'A2', 'A3');

prompt: What is the total number of users who have never logged in?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_never_logged_in_users  FROM users  WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM sessions);
schema: CREATE TABLE users (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   pwd Varchar NOT NULL,   obj_version Int NOT NULL,   login_type Varchar NOT NULL DEFAULT 'CINNAMON',   activated Boolean NOT NULL,   locked Boolean NOT NULL,   ui_language_id BigInt NOT NULL,   fullname Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   change_tracking Boolean NOT NULL,   token Varchar NOT NULL,   tokens_today Int NOT NULL,   password_expired Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE sessions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   expires Timestamp NOT NULL,   ticket Varchar NOT NULL,   username Varchar NOT NULL,   ui_language_id BigInt NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE ui_languages (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   iso_code Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE languages (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   iso_code Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE acls (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE folder_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   obj_version BigInt NOT NULL,   config Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<config />',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE folders (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   obj_version BigInt NOT NULL,   created Timestamp NOT NULL,   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL,   owner_id BigInt NOT NULL,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   metadata_changed Boolean NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<summary />',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE object_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   config Varchar NOT NULL DEFAULT '<meta />',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE formats (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   contenttype Varchar NOT NULL,   extension Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   obj_version BigInt NOT NULL,   default_object_type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE lifecycles (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   default_state_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (default_state_id) REFERENCES lifecycle_states (id) );  CREATE TABLE lifecycle_states (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   config Text NOT NULL,   state_class Varchar NOT NULL,   life_cycle_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE lifecycle_state_to_copy_state (   lifecycle_state_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   copy_state_id BigInt NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (lifecycle_state_id) REFERENCES lifecycle_states (id),   FOREIGN KEY (copy_state_id) REFERENCES lifecycle_states (id) );  CREATE TABLE objects (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   content_path Varchar NOT NULL,   content_size BigInt NOT NULL,   created Timestamp NOT NULL,   latest_branch Boolean NOT NULL,   latest_head Boolean NOT NULL,   modified Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   version BigInt NOT NULL,   cmn_version Varchar NOT NULL DEFAULT '1',   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL,   creator_id BigInt NOT NULL,   format_id BigInt NOT NULL,   language_id BigInt NOT NULL,   locker_id BigInt NOT NULL,   modifier_id BigInt NOT NULL,   owner_id BigInt NOT NULL,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL,   predecessor_id BigInt NOT NULL,   root_id BigInt NOT NULL,   type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   state_id BigInt NOT NULL,   content_changed Boolean NOT NULL,   metadata_changed Boolean NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<summary/>',   content_hash Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE links (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type Varchar NOT NULL,   owner_id BigInt NOT NULL,   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL,   folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   osd_id BigInt NOT NULL,   version BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE groups (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE acl_groups (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   group_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE group_users (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   group_id BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE permissions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE acl_group_permissions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   acl_group_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   permission_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE relation_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   left_object_protected Boolean NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   right_object_protected Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_right_copy Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_left_copy Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_left_version Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_right_version Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE relations (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   left_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   right_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   metadata Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<meta/>',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE metaset_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   is_unique Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE index_items (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   fieldname Varchar NOT NULL,   for_content Boolean NOT NULL,   for_metadata Boolean NOT NULL,   for_sys_meta Boolean NOT NULL,   multiple_results Boolean NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   search_string Text NOT NULL,   va_params Text NOT NULL,   index_type_name Varchar NOT NULL,   search_condition Text NOT NULL DEFAULT 'true()',   store_field Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE config_entries (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   config Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   public_visibility Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE osd_meta (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   osd_id BigInt NOT NULL,   content Text NOT NULL,   type_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE folder_meta (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   content Text NOT NULL,   type_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );

sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "name" FROM "users" WHERE "email" LIKE '%@example.com';
schema: CREATE TABLE users (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   pwd Varchar NOT NULL,   obj_version Int NOT NULL,   login_type Varchar NOT NULL DEFAULT 'CINNAMON',   activated Boolean NOT NULL,   locked Boolean NOT NULL,   ui_language_id BigInt NOT NULL,   fullname Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   change_tracking Boolean NOT NULL,   token Varchar NOT NULL,   tokens_today Int NOT NULL,   password_expired Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE sessions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   expires Timestamp NOT NULL,   ticket Varchar NOT NULL,   username Varchar NOT NULL,   ui_language_id BigInt NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE ui_languages (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   iso_code Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE languages (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   iso_code Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE acls (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE folder_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   obj_version BigInt NOT NULL,   config Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<config />',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE folders (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   obj_version BigInt NOT NULL,   created Timestamp NOT NULL,   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL,   owner_id BigInt NOT NULL,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   metadata_changed Boolean NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<summary />',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE object_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   config Varchar NOT NULL DEFAULT '<meta />',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE formats (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   contenttype Varchar NOT NULL,   extension Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   obj_version BigInt NOT NULL,   default_object_type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE lifecycles (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   default_state_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (default_state_id) REFERENCES lifecycle_states (id) );  CREATE TABLE lifecycle_states (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   config Text NOT NULL,   state_class Varchar NOT NULL,   life_cycle_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE lifecycle_state_to_copy_state (   lifecycle_state_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   copy_state_id BigInt NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (lifecycle_state_id) REFERENCES lifecycle_states (id),   FOREIGN KEY (copy_state_id) REFERENCES lifecycle_states (id) );  CREATE TABLE objects (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   content_path Varchar NOT NULL,   content_size BigInt NOT NULL,   created Timestamp NOT NULL,   latest_branch Boolean NOT NULL,   latest_head Boolean NOT NULL,   modified Timestamp NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   version BigInt NOT NULL,   cmn_version Varchar NOT NULL DEFAULT '1',   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL,   creator_id BigInt NOT NULL,   format_id BigInt NOT NULL,   language_id BigInt NOT NULL,   locker_id BigInt NOT NULL,   modifier_id BigInt NOT NULL,   owner_id BigInt NOT NULL,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL,   predecessor_id BigInt NOT NULL,   root_id BigInt NOT NULL,   type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   state_id BigInt NOT NULL,   content_changed Boolean NOT NULL,   metadata_changed Boolean NOT NULL,   summary Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<summary/>',   content_hash Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE links (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type Varchar NOT NULL,   owner_id BigInt NOT NULL,   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL,   folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   osd_id BigInt NOT NULL,   version BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE groups (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   parent_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE acl_groups (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   acl_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   group_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE group_users (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   group_id BigInt NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE permissions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE acl_group_permissions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   acl_group_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   permission_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE relation_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   left_object_protected Boolean NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   right_object_protected Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_right_copy Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_left_copy Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_left_version Boolean NOT NULL,   clone_on_right_version Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE relations (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   left_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   right_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type_id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   metadata Text NOT NULL DEFAULT '<meta/>',   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE metaset_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   is_unique Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE index_items (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   fieldname Varchar NOT NULL,   for_content Boolean NOT NULL,   for_metadata Boolean NOT NULL,   for_sys_meta Boolean NOT NULL,   multiple_results Boolean NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   search_string Text NOT NULL,   va_params Text NOT NULL,   index_type_name Varchar NOT NULL,   search_condition Text NOT NULL DEFAULT 'true()',   store_field Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE config_entries (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   config Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   public_visibility Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE osd_meta (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   osd_id BigInt NOT NULL,   content Text NOT NULL,   type_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE folder_meta (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   content Text NOT NULL,   type_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );

prompt: What percentage of folders have been modified since their creation?
sql_statement: SELECT CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN modified > created THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) AS percentage_modified_folders FROM folders;

prompt: Which UI language has the most associated users?
sql_statement: SELECT ui_languages.iso_code AS ui_language, COUNT(users.id) AS user_count FROM users JOIN ui_languages ON users.ui_language_id = ui_languages.id GROUP BY ui_languages.iso_code ORDER BY user_count DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: Find the average object size of objects created after January 1, 2023.
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(content_size) AS average_object_size FROM objects WHERE created > '2023-01-01';

prompt: How many unique groups are there in the system?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT id) AS unique_group_count FROM groups;

prompt: Identify the user who owns the folder named 'ProjectX'.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "name" FROM "users" WHERE "id" = (     SELECT "owner_id" FROM "folders" WHERE "name" = 'ProjectX' );

prompt: What is the default lifecycle state for the lifecycle named 'Standard'?
sql_statement: SELECT lifecycle_states.name  FROM lifecycles  JOIN lifecycle_states ON lifecycles.default_state_id = lifecycle_states.id  WHERE lifecycles.name = 'Standard';

prompt: List all relations where the left_id corresponds to an object of type 'Document'.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT r.id AS relation_id, r.left_id, r.right_id, r.type_id, o.name AS left_object_name FROM relations r JOIN objects o ON r.left_id = o.id JOIN object_types ot ON o.type_id = ot.id WHERE ot.name = 'Document';

prompt: Which country has the highest average credit limit among its customers?
sql_statement: SELECT country  FROM customers  GROUP BY country  ORDER BY AVG(creditLimit) DESC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE customers (   customerNumber Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   customerName Varchar NOT NULL,   contactLastName Varchar NOT NULL,   contactFirstName Varchar NOT NULL,   phone Varchar NOT NULL,   addressLine1 Varchar NOT NULL,   addressLine2 Varchar NOT NULL,   city Varchar NOT NULL,   state Varchar NOT NULL,   postalCode Varchar NOT NULL,   country Varchar NOT NULL,   salesRepEmployeeNumber Int NOT NULL,   creditLimit Double NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (customerNumber),   FOREIGN KEY (salesRepEmployeeNumber) REFERENCES employees (employeeNumber) );  CREATE TABLE offices (   officeCode Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   city Varchar NOT NULL,   phone Varchar NOT NULL,   addressLine1 Varchar NOT NULL,   addressLine2 Varchar NOT NULL,   state Varchar NOT NULL,   country Varchar NOT NULL,   postalCode Varchar NOT NULL,   territory Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (officeCode) );  CREATE TABLE employees (   employeeNumber Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   lastName Varchar NOT NULL,   firstName Varchar NOT NULL,   extension Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   officeCode Int NOT NULL,   reportsTo Int NOT NULL,   jobTitle Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (employeeNumber),   FOREIGN KEY (officeCode) REFERENCES offices (officeCode),   FOREIGN KEY (reportsTo) REFERENCES employees (employeeNumber) ); prompt: What is the total number of employees in the company who work out of offices located in France?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS totalEmployeesInFrance  FROM employees  JOIN offices ON employees.officeCode = offices.officeCode  WHERE offices.country = 'France';

prompt: Find the customer names whose first name starts with 'J' and are served by an employee named John Doe.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT c.customerName  FROM customers c JOIN employees e ON c.salesRepEmployeeNumber = e.employeeNumber WHERE c.contactFirstName LIKE 'J%' AND e.firstName = 'John' AND e.lastName = 'Doe';

prompt: How many orders were placed on February 14, 2023, and what was the average quantity ordered per product?
sql_statement: SELECT      COUNT(DISTINCT o.orderNumber) AS totalOrders,     AVG(od.quantityOrdered) AS averageQuantityPerOrder FROM      orders o JOIN      orderdetails od ON o.orderNumber = od.orderNumber WHERE      o.orderDate = '2023-02-14';

prompt: What is the total amount paid by customers from Germany in the year 2022?
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(amount) AS totalAmountPaid FROM payments JOIN customers ON payments.customerNumber = customers.customerNumber WHERE customers.country = 'Germany'   AND STRFTIME('%Y', payments.paymentDate) = '2022';

prompt: List all the product lines that have products with a buy price greater than $50.

prompt: Which office has the most employees working under it?
sql_statement: SELECT      o.city AS officeCity,      COUNT(e.employeeNumber) AS employeeCount FROM      offices o JOIN      employees e ON o.officeCode = e.officeCode GROUP BY      o.city ORDER BY      employeeCount DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: How many distinct products were ordered in 2021?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT productCode) AS distinctProductsCount  FROM orderdetails  JOIN orders ON orderdetails.orderNumber = orders.orderNumber  WHERE YEAR(orders.orderDate) = 2021;

prompt: What is the average price each of the top 5 most expensive products was sold for in 2023?
sql_statement: SELECT      p.productName,     AVG(od.priceEach) AS averagePrice FROM      products p JOIN      orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode JOIN      orders o ON od.orderNumber = o.orderNumber WHERE      YEAR(o.orderDate) = 2023 GROUP BY      p.productName, p.MSRP ORDER BY      p.MSRP DESC LIMIT 5;

prompt: Find the customer who has made the highest number of payments and list their total payment amount.
sql_statement: SELECT c.customerName, COUNT(p.checkNumber) AS paymentCount, SUM(p.amount) AS totalPaymentAmount FROM customers c JOIN payments p ON c.customerNumber = p.customerNumber GROUP BY c.customerNumber ORDER BY paymentCount DESC LIMIT 1;

 CREATE TABLE productlines (   productLine Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   textDescription Varchar NOT NULL,   htmlDescription mediumtext NOT NULL,   image TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (productLine) );  CREATE TABLE products (   productCode Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   productName Varchar NOT NULL,   productLine Varchar NOT NULL,   productScale Varchar NOT NULL,   productVendor Varchar NOT NULL,   productDescription Text NOT NULL,   quantityInStock SmallInt NOT NULL,   buyPrice Double NOT NULL,   MSRP Double NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (productCode),   FOREIGN KEY (productLine) REFERENCES productlines (productLine) );

prompt: List the usernames of users who have created more than 5 words.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT U.username  FROM Users U  JOIN Words W ON U.ID = W.creator_id  GROUP BY U.username  HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT W.word) > 5;

prompt: Find the user who has hosted the most games and provide their username.

sql_statement: SELECT "department_name"  FROM department  WHERE id IN (     SELECT department_id      FROM roles      GROUP BY department_id      HAVING COUNT(id) > 5 );
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: List all employees who have a manager with the last name 'Smith'.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT e.first_name, e.last_name  FROM employee e  JOIN employee m ON e.manager_id = m.id  WHERE m.last_name = 'Smith';
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: Find the average salary for each department.
sql_statement: SELECT      d.department_name,     AVG(r.salary) AS average_salary FROM      department d JOIN      roles r ON d.id = r.department_id GROUP BY      d.department_name;
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: How many employees report directly to the employee with ID 10?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS "number_of_employees"  FROM employee  WHERE manager_id = 10;
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: Which role has the highest salary and in which department is it located?
sql_statement: SELECT      r.title AS role_title,     d.department_name FROM      roles r JOIN      department d ON r.department_id = d.id ORDER BY      r.salary DESC LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: List the first and last names of employees who earn more than the average salary.
sql_statement: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name  FROM employee e  JOIN roles r ON e.role_id = r.id  WHERE r.salary > (SELECT AVG(salary) FROM roles);
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: What is the total number of roles in departments named 'Sales' or 'Marketing'?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_roles  FROM roles  JOIN department ON roles.department_id = department.id  WHERE department.department_name IN ('Sales', 'Marketing');
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: Find all employees whose role title contains the word 'Manager'.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT e.id, e.first_name, e.last_name  FROM employee e  JOIN roles r ON e.role_id = r.id  WHERE r.title LIKE '%Manager%';
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: How many employees are there in each department, ordered by the number of employees in descending order?
sql_statement: SELECT      d.department_name,     COUNT(e.id) AS employee_count FROM      department d JOIN      roles r ON d.id = r.department_id JOIN      employee e ON r.id = e.role_id GROUP BY      d.department_name ORDER BY      employee_count DESC;
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: List the titles of roles that have a salary less than $50,000 and the names of the departments they belong to.
sql_statement: SELECT      r.title AS role_title,      d.department_name  FROM      roles r JOIN      department d ON r.department_id = d.id WHERE      r.salary < 50000.00;
schema: CREATE TABLE department (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Decimal NOT NULL,   department_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES department (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE employee (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   role_id Int NOT NULL,   manager_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee (id),   FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (id) ON DELETE SET NULL );

prompt: How many comments are valid for each post?
sql_statement: SELECT post_id, COUNT(*) AS valid_comments_count  FROM comment  WHERE valid = 1  GROUP BY post_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: List all users who have made at least one comment.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT u.first_name, u.last_name  FROM user u  JOIN comment c ON u.id = c.user_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the average number of comments per user?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(comment_count) AS average_comments_per_user FROM (   SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS comment_count   FROM comment   GROUP BY user_id ) AS comments_per_user;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: Which user has the most comments on a single post?
sql_statement: SELECT u.first_name, u.last_name  FROM user u  JOIN comment c ON u.id = c.user_id  GROUP BY u.id  ORDER BY COUNT(c.id) DESC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: Find the total number of invalid comments in the database.

schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: Show the date and time when each user was created, sorted by creation date.
