schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: How many posts have more than 5 valid comments?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(post_id) AS num_posts_with_more_than_5_valid_comments  FROM comment  WHERE valid = 1  GROUP BY post_id  HAVING COUNT(post_id) > 5;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: List all users who are of type 'admin'.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT u.first_name, u.last_name  FROM user u  JOIN user_type ut ON u.user_type_id = ut.id  WHERE ut.user_type = 'admin';
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the percentage of comments that are valid across all posts?
sql_statement: SELECT      CAST(SUM(valid) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) AS percentage_valid_comments FROM      comment;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: For the post with the most comments, list all authors who commented on it.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT c.author  FROM comment c  JOIN (     SELECT post_id      FROM comment      GROUP BY post_id      ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC      LIMIT 1 ) most_commented_post ON c.post_id = most_commented_post.post_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE comment (   id Int NOT NULL,   author Varchar NOT NULL,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   valid TinyInt NOT NULL,   date_create Varchar NOT NULL,   post_id Int NOT NULL,   user_id Int NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE user (   id Int NOT NULL,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   user_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   date_create Datetime NOT NULL,   user_type_id Int NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (user_type_id) REFERENCES user_type (id) );  CREATE TABLE user_type (   id Int NOT NULL,   user_type Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the total length of all strings in column t1?
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(LENGTH(t1)) AS total_length FROM user;
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: How many unique values are there in column t3?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT "t3") AS unique_t3_values FROM user;
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: List all combinations of values from columns t4 and t5.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "t4", "t5" FROM "user";
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: Find the longest string in column t7 and its corresponding value in t8.
sql_statement: SELECT t7 AS longest_string, t8 AS corresponding_value FROM user ORDER BY LENGTH(t7) DESC LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: Sum up the number of characters in column t2 that contain at least one digit.
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN REGEXP('[0-9]', t2) THEN LENGTH(t2) ELSE 0 END) AS total_characters_with_digits FROM user;
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the average length of strings in column t6?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(LENGTH(t6)) AS average_length FROM user;
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: How many times does "a" appear in all strings of column t1?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count_of_a FROM user WHERE t1 LIKE '%a%';
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: List the values from column t4 that are palindromes.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "t4"  FROM "user"  WHERE "t4" = REVERSE("t4");
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: Find the shortest string in column t5 and its index in the table.
sql_statement: SELECT t5 AS shortest_string, ROWID AS index_in_table  FROM user  ORDER BY LENGTH(t5) ASC  LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: How many strings in column t8 start with a vowel?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS "count"  FROM user  WHERE LOWER(t8) LIKE 'a%' OR LOWER(t8) LIKE 'e%' OR LOWER(t8) LIKE 'i%' OR LOWER(t8) LIKE 'o%' OR LOWER(t8) LIKE 'u%';
schema: CREATE TABLE user (   t1 Varchar NOT NULL,   t2 Varchar NOT NULL,   t3 Varchar NOT NULL,   t4 Varchar NOT NULL,   t5 Varchar NOT NULL,   t6 Varchar NOT NULL,   t7 Varchar NOT NULL,   t8 Varchar NOT NULL );

prompt: List the distinct email addresses that have sent more than 10 emails.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "from_address"  FROM "email"  GROUP BY "from_address"  HAVING COUNT(*) > 10;
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: Find the total number of attachments in all emails received after January 1, 2023.
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_attachments FROM email_attachment WHERE email IN (   SELECT id   FROM email   WHERE received_on > '2023-01-01' );
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: Retrieve the subjects of emails that contain the word "urgent" in their content.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "subject"  FROM "email"  WHERE "raw_data" LIKE '%urgent%';
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: What is the average size of attachments for emails from a specific sender address?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(CAST(LENGTH(data) AS REAL)) AS average_attachment_size FROM email_attachment WHERE email IN (   SELECT id   FROM email   WHERE from_address = 'specific_sender@example.com' );
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: List the email IDs where the subject line contains exactly three words.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "from_address"  FROM "email"  WHERE LENGTH("subject") - LENGTH(REPLACE("subject", ' ', '')) = 2;
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: Identify the email addresses that have never sent any attachments.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT e.from_address  FROM email e  LEFT JOIN email_attachment ea ON e.id = ea.email  WHERE ea.id IS NULL;
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: How many different content types are present in the email_content table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT content_type) AS distinct_content_types FROM email_content;
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: Find the number of emails received each day in October 2023, grouped by the day.
sql_statement: SELECT      DATE(received_on) AS "day",      COUNT(*) AS "number_of_emails" FROM      email WHERE      received_on >= '2023-10-01' AND received_on < '2023-11-01' GROUP BY      day;
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: List all email subjects containing at least one numeric character.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT subject  FROM email  WHERE subject LIKE '%[0-9]%';
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: Which sender address has the highest number of emails with a specific attachment filename?
sql_statement: SELECT e.from_address, COUNT(ea.email) AS attachment_count FROM email e JOIN email_attachment ea ON e.id = ea.email WHERE ea.filename = 'specific_attachment_filename' GROUP BY e.from_address ORDER BY attachment_count DESC LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE email (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   from_address Varchar NOT NULL,   to_address Varchar NOT NULL,   subject Text NOT NULL,   received_on Timestamp NOT NULL,   raw_data Text NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE email_content (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   content_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data Text NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE email_attachment (   id BigInt NOT NULL,   email BigInt NOT NULL,   filename Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   FOREIGN KEY (email) REFERENCES email (id) ON DELETE CASCADE );

prompt: What is the total number of constellations in each region?
sql_statement: SELECT region.regionName AS RegionName, COUNT(constellation.constellationId) AS ConstellationCount FROM region JOIN constellation ON region.regionId = constellation.regionId GROUP BY region.regionName;

 CREATE TABLE alliance (   allianceId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   allianceName Varchar NOT NULL,   ticker Varchar NOT NULL,   dateFounded Date NOT NULL,   executorCorp Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (allianceId) );  CREATE TABLE corporation (   corpId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   corpName Varchar NOT NULL,   ticker Varchar NOT NULL,   allianceId Int NOT NULL,   ceo Int NOT NULL,   creator Int NOT NULL,   creationDate Date NOT NULL,   memberCount Int NOT NULL,   taxRate Float NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (corpId) );  CREATE TABLE character (   charId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   charName Varchar NOT NULL,   corpId Int NOT NULL,   allianceId Int NOT NULL,   birthday Date NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (charId) );  CREATE TABLE structure (   structId BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   structName Varchar NOT NULL,   corpId Int NOT NULL,   systemId Int NOT NULL,   regionId Int NOT NULL,   typeId Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (structId) );  CREATE TABLE dirtlist (   listId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   userId Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   public Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (listId) );  CREATE TABLE doctrine (   doctrine Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   listId Int NOT NULL,   locationId BigInt NOT NULL,   quantity Int NOT NULL,   target Int NOT NULL,   lowestPrice Decimal NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (doctrine),   FOREIGN KEY (listId) REFERENCES dirtlist (listId) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE wallettransaction (   transactionId BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   charId Int NOT NULL,   clientId Int NOT NULL,   date Timestamp NOT NULL,   isBuy Boolean NOT NULL,   isPersonal Boolean NOT NULL,   typeId Int NOT NULL,   quantity Int NOT NULL,   unitPrice Decimal NOT NULL,   locationId BigInt NOT NULL,   journalRefId BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (transactionId) );  CREATE TABLE walletbalance (   charId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   balance Decimal NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (charId) );  CREATE TABLE contracttype (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   value Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE contractstatus (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   value Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE contractavailability (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   value Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE contract (   contractId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type Int NOT NULL,   status Int NOT NULL,   availability Int NOT NULL,   issuerId Int NOT NULL,   issuerCorpId Int NOT NULL,   forCorp Boolean NOT NULL,   assigneeId Int NOT NULL,   acceptorId Int NOT NULL,   dateIssued Timestamp NOT NULL,   dateExpired Timestamp NOT NULL,   dateAccepted Timestamp NOT NULL,   dateCompleted Timestamp NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   price Decimal NOT NULL,   startLocationId BigInt NOT NULL,   endLocationId BigInt NOT NULL,   daysToComplete Int NOT NULL,   reward Decimal NOT NULL,   collateral Decimal NOT NULL,   buyout Decimal NOT NULL,   volume Decimal NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (contractId),   FOREIGN KEY (type) REFERENCES contracttype (id),   FOREIGN KEY (status) REFERENCES contractstatus (id),   FOREIGN KEY (availability) REFERENCES contractavailability (id) );  CREATE TABLE publiccontract (   contractId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type Int NOT NULL,   status Int NOT NULL,   issuerId Int NOT NULL,   issuerCorpId Int NOT NULL,   forCorp Boolean NOT NULL,   dateIssued Timestamp NOT NULL,   dateExpired Timestamp NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   price Decimal NOT NULL,   regionId Int NOT NULL,   startLocationId BigInt NOT NULL,   endLocationId BigInt NOT NULL,   daysToComplete Int NOT NULL,   reward Decimal NOT NULL,   collateral Decimal NOT NULL,   buyout Decimal NOT NULL,   volume Decimal NOT NULL,   lastSeen Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (contractId),   FOREIGN KEY (type) REFERENCES contracttype (id),   FOREIGN KEY (status) REFERENCES contractstatus (id) );  CREATE TABLE publiccontractitem (   contractItemId Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   contractId Int NOT NULL,   typeId Int NOT NULL,   quantity Int NOT NULL,   recordId BigInt NOT NULL,   included Boolean NOT NULL,   isBpc Boolean NOT NULL,   itemId BigInt NOT NULL,   matEfficiency Int NOT NULL,   timeEfficiency Int NOT NULL,   runs Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (contractItemId),   FOREIGN KEY (contractId) REFERENCES publiccontract (contractId) ON DELETE CASCADE );  CREATE TABLE marketorder (   issued Timestamp NOT NULL,   range Varchar NOT NULL,   isBuyOrder Boolean NOT NULL,   duration Int NOT NULL,   orderId BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   volumeRemain Int NOT NULL,   minVolume Int NOT NULL,   typeId Int NOT NULL,   volumeTotal Int NOT NULL,   locationId BigInt NOT NULL,   price Decimal NOT NULL,   regionId Int NOT NULL,   retrieved Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (orderId) );  CREATE TABLE meriskvolume (   date Date NOT NULL UNIQUE,   iskVolume BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (date) );  CREATE TABLE mermoneysupply (   date Date NOT NULL UNIQUE,   character BigInt NOT NULL,   corporation BigInt NOT NULL,   total BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (date) );  CREATE TABLE merproddestmine (   date Date NOT NULL UNIQUE,   produced BigInt NOT NULL,   destroyed BigInt NOT NULL,   mined BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (date) );  CREATE TABLE dentity (   id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE dlocation (   locationId BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   locationName Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (locationId) );

prompt: Find the average distance (x, y, z) from the origin for all solar systems.
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(x) AS avg_x, AVG(y) AS avg_y, AVG(z) AS avg_z FROM solarsystem;

prompt: Which corporation has the highest tax rate and how many members does it have?
sql_statement: SELECT corpName AS CorporationName, memberCount AS MemberCount FROM corporation ORDER BY taxRate DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: How many structures are there per type in each region?
sql_statement: SELECT      r.regionName AS Region,     t.typeName AS Type,     COUNT(s.structId) AS NumberOfStructures FROM      structure s JOIN      region r ON s.regionId = r.regionId JOIN      invtype t ON s.typeId = t.typeId GROUP BY      r.regionName, t.typeName;

prompt: What is the total amount of money spent on buying items by characters in a specific month?
sql_statement: SELECT      SUM(unitPrice * quantity) AS total_spent FROM      wallettransaction WHERE      isBuy = TRUE AND     strftime('%Y-%m', date) = 'YYYY-MM';

prompt: List the top 5 most expensive market orders for a particular item type.
sql_statement: SELECT      mo.orderId AS OrderID,     it.typeName AS ItemTypeName,     mo.price AS PricePerUnit,     mo.volumeRemain AS RemainingVolume,     mo.issued AS IssuedDate,     mo.locationId AS LocationID FROM      marketorder mo JOIN      invtype it ON mo.typeId = it.typeId WHERE      it.marketGroupId = (SELECT marketGroupId FROM invtype WHERE typeName = 'YourItemType')  -- Replace 'YourItemType' with the specific item type you are interested in. ORDER BY      mo.price DESC LIMIT 5;

prompt: Calculate the percentage of alliances that have more than 100 corporations.
sql_statement: SELECT      CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN corporation_count > 100 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) AS percentage_of_alliances_with_more_than_100_corporations FROM (     SELECT allianceId, COUNT(corpId) AS corporation_count     FROM corporation     GROUP BY allianceId ) AS alliance_corporation_counts;

prompt: Which character has made the most transactions in terms of quantity, and how many transactions did they make?
sql_statement: SELECT charName, SUM(quantity) AS totalTransactions FROM wallettransaction JOIN character ON wallettransaction.charId = character.charId GROUP BY charName ORDER BY totalTransactions DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: What is the total volume of all contracts completed by a specific corporation?
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(volume) AS total_volume FROM contract JOIN corporation ON contract.issuerCorpId = corporation.corpId WHERE corporation.corpName = 'Specific Corporation Name';

prompt: How many unique invoice lines are there in the TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT CUSTOMER_TRX_LINE_ID) AS unique_invoice_lines FROM TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES;
schema: CREATE TABLE TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES (   CUSTOMER_TRX_ID TEXT NOT NULL,   CUSTOMER_TRX_LINE_ID TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_DESC TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_ITEM_TYPE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_ITEM_CODE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_TYPE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_QTY TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_SOLD TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_AMOUNT_EGP TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_AMOUNT_SOLD TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_RATE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_SALES_TOTAL TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TOTAL TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_VAL_DIFF TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TOTAL_TAX_FEES TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_NET_TOTAL TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_ITEM_DISC TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_DISCOUNT_RATE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_DISCOUNT_AMT TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_TYPE_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_AMT_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_SUBTYPE_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_RATE_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_TYPE_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_AMT_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_SUBTYPE_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_RATE_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_INTERNAL_CODE TEXT NOT NULL );

prompt: What is the total sales amount (INV_LINES_SALES_TOTAL) for all invoice lines with an item type of "Product"?
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(INV_LINES_SALES_TOTAL) AS TOTAL_SALES_AMOUNT  FROM TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES  WHERE INV_LINES_ITEM_TYPE = 'Product';

prompt: List the descriptions (INV_LINES_DESC) and unit values (INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_SOLD) for items sold in Egyptian Pounds (EGP).
sql_statement: SELECT      "INV_LINES_DESC",      "INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_SOLD"  FROM      "TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES" WHERE      "INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_RATE" = 'EGP';

prompt: How many invoice lines have a total tax fee (INV_LINES_TOTAL_TAX_FEES) greater than 500 EGP?

prompt: List the internal codes (INV_LINES_INTERNAL_CODE) and their corresponding item types (INV_LINES_ITEM_TYPE) where the item code (INV_LINES_ITEM_CODE) starts with "A".
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "INV_LINES_INTERNAL_CODE", "INV_LINES_ITEM_TYPE"  FROM "TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES"  WHERE "INV_LINES_ITEM_CODE" LIKE 'A%';
schema: CREATE TABLE TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES (   CUSTOMER_TRX_ID TEXT NOT NULL,   CUSTOMER_TRX_LINE_ID TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_DESC TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_ITEM_TYPE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_ITEM_CODE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_TYPE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_QTY TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_SOLD TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_AMOUNT_EGP TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_AMOUNT_SOLD TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_UNIT_VAL_CURR_RATE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_SALES_TOTAL TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TOTAL TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_VAL_DIFF TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TOTAL_TAX_FEES TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_NET_TOTAL TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_ITEM_DISC TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_DISCOUNT_RATE TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_DISCOUNT_AMT TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_TYPE_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_AMT_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_SUBTYPE_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_RATE_vat TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_TYPE_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_AMT_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_SUBTYPE_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_RATE_wht TEXT NOT NULL,   INV_LINES_INTERNAL_CODE TEXT NOT NULL );

prompt: Among all invoice lines, what percentage of them have a VAT tax rate (INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_RATE_vat) higher than 14%?
sql_statement: SELECT      CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN INV_LINES_TAX_ITEM_RATE_vat > '14' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) AS percentage_vat_higher_than_14 FROM      TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES;

prompt: Provide the sum of total net amounts (INV_LINES_NET_TOTAL) for items whose description contains the keyword "Service".
sql_statement: SELECT SUM(INV_LINES_NET_TOTAL) AS total_net_amount FROM TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES WHERE INV_LINES_DESC LIKE '%Service%';

prompt: How many unique customer transaction IDs (CUSTOMER_TRX_ID) are associated with invoice lines sold in quantities greater than 50 units?
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "CUSTOMER_TRX_ID"  FROM "TRS_ETA_INVOICES_LINES"  WHERE CAST("INV_LINES_QTY" AS REAL) > 50;

prompt: How many activities were recorded on the latest date in the activity table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS latest_date_activity_count  FROM activity  WHERE date = (     SELECT MAX(date) FROM activity );
schema: CREATE TABLE activity (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   program_id BigInt NOT NULL,   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   assay_id BigInt NOT NULL,   event_type Varchar NOT NULL,   data TEXT NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   date Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (assay_id) REFERENCES assays (id),   FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs (id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id),   FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users (id) );  CREATE TABLE assay_tasks (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   status Varchar NOT NULL,   label Varchar NOT NULL,   task_order Integer NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   assay_id BigInt NOT NULL,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   last_modified_by BigInt NOT NULL,   assigned_to BigInt NOT NULL,   due_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (assay_id) REFERENCES assays (id),   FOREIGN KEY (assigned_to) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users (id) );  CREATE TABLE assay_type_fields (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   display_name Varchar NOT NULL,   field_name Varchar NOT NULL,   type Varchar NOT NULL,   required Boolean NOT NULL,   description Varchar NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   assay_type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (assay_type_id) REFERENCES assay_types (id) );  CREATE TABLE assay_type_tasks (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   status Varchar NOT NULL,   label Varchar NOT NULL,   task_order Integer NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   assay_type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (assay_type_id) REFERENCES assay_types (id) );  CREATE TABLE assay_types (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   description Varchar NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   attributes TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE assay_users (   assay_id BigInt NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (assay_id, user_id),   FOREIGN KEY (assay_id) REFERENCES assays (id),   FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users (id) );  CREATE TABLE assays (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   status Varchar NOT NULL,   assay_type_id BigInt NOT NULL,   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   code Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   description Text NOT NULL,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   last_modified_by BigInt NOT NULL,   owner BigInt NOT NULL,   start_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   end_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   notebook_folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   storage_folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   fields TEXT NOT NULL,   attributes TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (assay_type_id) REFERENCES assay_types (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (notebook_folder_id) REFERENCES eln_folders (id),   FOREIGN KEY (owner) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (storage_folder_id) REFERENCES file_store_folders (id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id) );  CREATE TABLE collaborators (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   label Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   organization_name Varchar NOT NULL,   organization_location Varchar NOT NULL,   contact_person_name Varchar NOT NULL,   contact_email Varchar NOT NULL,   code Varchar NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE comments (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   text Text NOT NULL,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id) );  CREATE TABLE eln_folders (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   path Varchar NOT NULL,   reference_id Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE external_links (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   label Varchar NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id) );  CREATE TABLE file_store_folders (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   path Varchar NOT NULL,   reference_id Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE keywords (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   keyword Varchar NOT NULL,   category Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );  CREATE TABLE notebook_entry_templates (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   template_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   last_modified_by BigInt NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users (id) );  CREATE TABLE programs (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   code Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   description Text NOT NULL,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   last_modified_by BigInt NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   notebook_folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   storage_folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   attributes TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (notebook_folder_id) REFERENCES eln_folders (id),   FOREIGN KEY (storage_folder_id) REFERENCES file_store_folders (id) );  CREATE TABLE studies (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   code Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   external_code Varchar NOT NULL,   status Varchar NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   program_id BigInt NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   collaborator_id BigInt NOT NULL,   legacy Boolean NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   notebook_folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   storage_folder_id BigInt NOT NULL,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   last_modified_by BigInt NOT NULL,   start_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   end_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   owner BigInt NOT NULL,   attributes TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (collaborator_id) REFERENCES collaborators (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (notebook_folder_id) REFERENCES eln_folders (id),   FOREIGN KEY (owner) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs (id),   FOREIGN KEY (storage_folder_id) REFERENCES file_store_folders (id) );  CREATE TABLE study_conclusions (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   content Text NOT NULL,   created_by BigInt NOT NULL,   last_modified_by BigInt NOT NULL,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (created_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (last_modified_by) REFERENCES users (id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id) );  CREATE TABLE study_keywords (   keyword_id BigInt NOT NULL,   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (keyword_id, study_id),   FOREIGN KEY (keyword_id) REFERENCES keywords (id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id) );  CREATE TABLE study_relationships (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   type Varchar NOT NULL,   source_study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   target_study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id),   FOREIGN KEY (source_study_id) REFERENCES studies (id),   FOREIGN KEY (target_study_id) REFERENCES studies (id) );  CREATE TABLE study_users (   study_id BigInt NOT NULL,   user_id BigInt NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (study_id, user_id),   FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES studies (id),   FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users (id) );  CREATE TABLE users (   id BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   username Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   password Varchar NOT NULL,   department Varchar NOT NULL,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   display_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   created_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   updated_at Timestamp NOT NULL,   attributes TEXT NOT NULL,   admin Boolean NOT NULL,   active Boolean NOT NULL,   locked Boolean NOT NULL,   expired Boolean NOT NULL,   credentials_expired Boolean NOT NULL,   configuration TEXT NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );

prompt: Which user has created the most assays? Provide their username.
sql_statement: SELECT u.username  FROM users u JOIN assays a ON u.id = a.created_by GROUP BY u.id ORDER BY COUNT(a.id) DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: What is the total number of unique studies associated with active programs?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT study_id) AS unique_study_count  FROM activity  WHERE program_id IN (     SELECT id FROM programs WHERE active = TRUE );

prompt: List the names of all assay types that have at least one task with a 'status' of 'completed'.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT at.name AS assay_type_name FROM assay_types at JOIN assays a ON at.id = a.assay_type_id JOIN assay_tasks ats ON a.id = ats.assay_id WHERE ats.status = 'completed';

prompt: Find the collaborator with the highest number of studies and provide their organization name.
sql_statement: SELECT      c.organization_name FROM      collaborators c JOIN      studies s ON c.id = s.collaborator_id GROUP BY      c.id, c.organization_name ORDER BY      COUNT(s.id) DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: What is the average payment (pay) for annonces in the 'Technology' category?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(pay) AS average_payment FROM annonce WHERE categorie = 'Technology';
schema: CREATE TABLE annonce (   id_ann Int NOT NULL,   id_user Int NOT NULL,   titre_ann Varchar NOT NULL,   desc_ann Varchar NOT NULL,   pay Int NOT NULL,   categorie Varchar NOT NULL,   ddl_ann Date NOT NULL ); prompt: Which user has posted the most annonces?

prompt: Among all users, who has the highest average rating for the events they have attended?
sql_statement: SELECT      u.id_user,      u.nom,      u.prenom,      AVG(re.rating) AS average_rating FROM      user u JOIN      participant p ON u.id_user = p.id_user JOIN      rating_event re ON p.id_event = re.id_event GROUP BY      u.id_user, u.nom, u.prenom ORDER BY      average_rating DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: Which category has the most annonces and how many are there?

prompt: List the usernames of users who have posted more than 5 comments.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT u.username  FROM user u JOIN comments c ON u.id_user = c.id_user GROUP BY u.id_user HAVING COUNT(c.id_comment) > 5;

prompt: What is the total number of unique statuses recorded in the refdata_status table?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT "statusdesc") AS unique_statuses_count FROM "refdata_status";
schema: CREATE TABLE refdata_status (   statusid SmallInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   statusdesc Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   PRIMARY KEY (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE appdata_auditlog (   auditlogid BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   msgprocesseddate Varchar,   msgprocessedtime Varchar,   processedtype Varchar,   industrystd Varchar,   componentname Varchar,   msgtrigger Varchar,   msgid Varchar,   internalID Varchar,   createddate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (auditlogid),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE appdata_auditlog_msgs (   auditlogmsgsid BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   msgid Int,   msgdata Text,   msgdatalink Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (auditlogmsgsid),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE refdata_industrystd (   industrystd Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   industrystddesc Varchar,   CreatedDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (industrystd),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE refdata_msgtrigger (   msgtriggerid Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   msgtriggerdesc Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (msgtriggerid),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE refdata_processingtype (   processingtypeID Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   processingtypedesc Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (processingtypeID),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );

prompt: List all audit logs created after January 1, 2023, along with their processed type and industry standard.
sql_statement: SELECT      auditlogid AS AuditLogID,     processedtype AS ProcessedType,     industrystd AS IndustryStandard FROM      appdata_auditlog WHERE      createddate > '2023-01-01 00:00:00';

prompt: How many messages are associated with each status in the appdata_auditlog_msgs table?
sql_statement: SELECT      statusid,      COUNT(*) AS message_count  FROM      appdata_auditlog_msgs  GROUP BY      statusid;

prompt: Retrieve the descriptions of all industry standards that have been inactive for more than a year.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT industrystddesc  FROM refdata_industrystd  WHERE statusid IN (     SELECT statusid      FROM refdata_status      WHERE createdDate <= DATE('now', '-1 year') );

prompt: What is the average number of different words in msgdata entries created between January 1, 2022, and December 31, 2022?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(DISTINCT_WORD_COUNT) AS average_distinct_words FROM (     SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT word) AS DISTINCT_WORD_COUNT     FROM appdata_auditlog_msgs     WHERE createdDate BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31'     CROSS JOIN (         SELECT value AS word         FROM appdata_auditlog_msgs, json_each(msgdata)     ) words     GROUP BY auditlogmsgsid ) subquery;
schema: CREATE TABLE refdata_status (   statusid SmallInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   statusdesc Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   PRIMARY KEY (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE appdata_auditlog (   auditlogid BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   msgprocesseddate Varchar,   msgprocessedtime Varchar,   processedtype Varchar,   industrystd Varchar,   componentname Varchar,   msgtrigger Varchar,   msgid Varchar,   internalID Varchar,   createddate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (auditlogid),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE appdata_auditlog_msgs (   auditlogmsgsid BigInt NOT NULL UNIQUE,   msgid Int,   msgdata Text,   msgdatalink Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (auditlogmsgsid),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE refdata_industrystd (   industrystd Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   industrystddesc Varchar,   CreatedDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (industrystd),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE refdata_msgtrigger (   msgtriggerid Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   msgtriggerdesc Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (msgtriggerid),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );  CREATE TABLE refdata_processingtype (   processingtypeID Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   processingtypedesc Varchar,   createdDate Timestamp,   statusid SmallInt,   PRIMARY KEY (processingtypeID),   FOREIGN KEY (statusid) REFERENCES refdata_status (statusid) );

prompt: Among the jobs with a minimum salary of at least $50,000, list their job titles.
sql_statement: SELECT DISTINCT "job_title" FROM "demo_hr_jobs" WHERE "min_salary" >= 50000;
schema: CREATE TABLE demo_hr_jobs (   job_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   job_title Varchar NOT NULL,   min_salary Integer NOT NULL,   max_salary Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (job_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_jobs_snapshot (   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   job_title Varchar NOT NULL,   min_salary Integer NOT NULL,   max_salary Integer NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_regions (   region_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   region_name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (region_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_countries (   country_id Char NOT NULL UNIQUE,   country_name Varchar NOT NULL,   region_id Integer NOT NULL,   date_last_updated Date NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (country_id),   FOREIGN KEY (region_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_regions (region_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_locations (   location_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   street_address Varchar NOT NULL,   postal_code Varchar NOT NULL,   city Varchar NOT NULL,   state_province Varchar NOT NULL,   country_id Char NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (location_id),   FOREIGN KEY (country_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_countries (country_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_departments (   department_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   manager_id Integer NOT NULL,   location_id Integer NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (department_id),   FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_locations (location_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_job_history (   employee_id Integer NOT NULL,   start_date Date NOT NULL,   end_date Date NOT NULL,   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   department_id Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (employee_id, start_date),   FOREIGN KEY (job_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_jobs (job_id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_departments (department_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_employees (   employee_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   phone_number Varchar NOT NULL,   hire_date Date NOT NULL,   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Integer NOT NULL,   commission_pct Numeric NOT NULL,   manager_id Integer NOT NULL,   department_id Integer NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt1 Varchar NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt2 Varchar NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt3 Varchar NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt4 Varchar NOT NULL,   fake_ssn Varchar NOT NULL,   zip5 Varchar NOT NULL,   zip5or9 Varchar NOT NULL,   zip9 Varchar NOT NULL,   email_address Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (employee_id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_departments (department_id),   FOREIGN KEY (job_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_jobs (job_id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_employees (employee_id) );

prompt: Calculate the average salary for employees who have worked in more than 3 departments during their career.
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(salary) AS average_salary FROM (     SELECT employee_id     FROM demo_hr_job_history     GROUP BY employee_id     HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT department_id) > 3 ) AS employees_with_multiple_departments JOIN demo_hr_employees ON employees_with_multiple_departments.employee_id = demo_hr_employees.employee_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE demo_hr_jobs (   job_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   job_title Varchar NOT NULL,   min_salary Integer NOT NULL,   max_salary Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (job_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_jobs_snapshot (   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   job_title Varchar NOT NULL,   min_salary Integer NOT NULL,   max_salary Integer NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_locations (   location_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   street_address Varchar NOT NULL,   postal_code Varchar NOT NULL,   city Varchar NOT NULL,   state_province Varchar NOT NULL,   country_id Char NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (location_id),   FOREIGN KEY (country_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_countries (country_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_departments (   department_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   department_name Varchar NOT NULL,   manager_id Integer NOT NULL,   location_id Integer NOT NULL,   url Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (department_id),   FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_locations (location_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_job_history (   employee_id Integer NOT NULL,   start_date Date NOT NULL,   end_date Date NOT NULL,   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   department_id Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (employee_id, start_date),   FOREIGN KEY (job_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_jobs (job_id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_departments (department_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_employees (   employee_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   first_name Varchar NOT NULL,   last_name Varchar NOT NULL,   email Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   phone_number Varchar NOT NULL,   hire_date Date NOT NULL,   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   salary Integer NOT NULL,   commission_pct Numeric NOT NULL,   manager_id Integer NOT NULL,   department_id Integer NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt1 Varchar NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt2 Varchar NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt3 Varchar NOT NULL,   some_date_fmt4 Varchar NOT NULL,   fake_ssn Varchar NOT NULL,   zip5 Varchar NOT NULL,   zip5or9 Varchar NOT NULL,   zip9 Varchar NOT NULL,   email_address Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (employee_id),   FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_departments (department_id),   FOREIGN KEY (job_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_jobs (job_id),   FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_employees (employee_id) );

prompt: What percentage of employees have a manager who is also an employee in the same department?
sql_statement: SELECT      CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN e.department_id = m.department_id THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(e.employee_id) AS percentage_of_employees_with_manager_in_same_department FROM      demo_hr_employees e LEFT JOIN      demo_hr_employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id;
schema: CREATE TABLE demo_hr_jobs (   job_id Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   job_title Varchar NOT NULL,   min_salary Integer NOT NULL,   max_salary Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (job_id) );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_jobs_snapshot (   job_id Varchar NOT NULL,   job_title Varchar NOT NULL,   min_salary Integer NOT NULL,   max_salary Integer NOT NULL );  CREATE TABLE demo_hr_locations (   location_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   street_address Varchar NOT NULL,   postal_code Varchar NOT NULL,   city Varchar NOT NULL,   state_province Varchar NOT NULL,   country_id Char NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (location_id),   FOREIGN KEY (country_id) REFERENCES demo_hr_countries (country_id) ); prompt: Provide the names and email addresses of all employees who joined the company in 2015.
sql_statement: SELECT first_name, last_name, email  FROM demo_hr_employees  WHERE strftime('%Y', hire_date) = '2015';

prompt: What is the average latitude of all stations located in Europe?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(CAST(latitude AS REAL)) AS average_latitude  FROM stations  WHERE location LIKE '%Europe%';
schema: CREATE TABLE stations (   station_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   social_reason Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_1 Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_2 Varchar NOT NULL,   location Varchar NOT NULL,   latitude TEXT NOT NULL,   longitude TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Datetime NOT NULL,   last_updated_at Datetime NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (station_id) );  CREATE TABLE reviews (   review_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   stars Integer NOT NULL,   station_id Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (review_id) );  CREATE TABLE states (   url Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (url) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   role_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   parent_role Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (role_id) );

prompt: How many reviews have a rating of 5 stars for each station, ordered by the number of reviews in descending order?
sql_statement: SELECT stations.name AS station_name, COUNT(reviews.review_id) AS five_star_review_count  FROM reviews  JOIN stations ON reviews.station_id = stations.station_id  WHERE reviews.stars = 5  GROUP BY stations.station_id  ORDER BY five_star_review_count DESC;
schema: CREATE TABLE stations (   station_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   social_reason Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_1 Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_2 Varchar NOT NULL,   location Varchar NOT NULL,   latitude TEXT NOT NULL,   longitude TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Datetime NOT NULL,   last_updated_at Datetime NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (station_id) );  CREATE TABLE reviews (   review_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   stars Integer NOT NULL,   station_id Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (review_id) );  CREATE TABLE states (   url Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (url) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   role_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   parent_role Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (role_id) );

prompt: List the names and addresses of all stations that are within the state of California.
sql_statement: SELECT "name", "address_line_1" || ' ' || "address_line_2" AS "address" FROM stations WHERE "location" LIKE '%California%';
schema: CREATE TABLE stations (   station_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   social_reason Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_1 Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_2 Varchar NOT NULL,   location Varchar NOT NULL,   latitude TEXT NOT NULL,   longitude TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Datetime NOT NULL,   last_updated_at Datetime NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (station_id) );  CREATE TABLE reviews (   review_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   stars Integer NOT NULL,   station_id Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (review_id) );  CREATE TABLE states (   url Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (url) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   role_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   parent_role Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (role_id) );

prompt: Find the total count of stations grouped by their location (e.g., city or neighborhood).
sql_statement: SELECT location, COUNT(*) AS station_count  FROM stations  GROUP BY location;
schema: CREATE TABLE stations (   station_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   social_reason Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_1 Varchar NOT NULL,   address_line_2 Varchar NOT NULL,   location Varchar NOT NULL,   latitude TEXT NOT NULL,   longitude TEXT NOT NULL,   created_at Datetime NOT NULL,   last_updated_at Datetime NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (station_id) );  CREATE TABLE reviews (   review_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   comment Varchar NOT NULL,   stars Integer NOT NULL,   station_id Integer NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (review_id) );  CREATE TABLE states (   url Varchar NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (url) );  CREATE TABLE roles (   role_id Integer NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   parent_role Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (role_id) );

prompt: Provide the count of stations for each state, ordered by the number of stations in descending order.
sql_statement: SELECT      states.name AS state_name,      COUNT(stations.station_id) AS station_count FROM      stations JOIN      locations ON stations.location = locations.location_id JOIN      states ON locations.state_url = states.url GROUP BY      states.name ORDER BY      station_count DESC;

prompt: What is the average score of posts that have been rated as 'Sketchy'?
sql_statement: SELECT AVG(score) AS average_score FROM posts WHERE rating = 'Sketchy';
schema: CREATE TABLE posts (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   poster Integer NOT NULL,   tag_vector TEXT NOT NULL,   create_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   modified_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   rating TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'Sketchy',   score Integer NOT NULL,   views Integer NOT NULL,   source Text NOT NULL,   filename Text NOT NULL,   path Text NOT NULL,   ext TEXT NOT NULL,   size Integer NOT NULL,   width Integer NOT NULL,   height Integer NOT NULL,   is_deleted Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );

prompt: How many posts were created in the year 2021?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(*) AS "number_of_posts_in_2021" FROM posts WHERE strftime('%Y', create_date) = '2021';

prompt: Which source has the maximum number of unique posters?

schema: CREATE TABLE posts (   id TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,   poster Integer NOT NULL,   tag_vector TEXT NOT NULL,   create_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   modified_date Timestamp NOT NULL,   description Text NOT NULL,   rating TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'Sketchy',   score Integer NOT NULL,   views Integer NOT NULL,   source Text NOT NULL,   filename Text NOT NULL,   path Text NOT NULL,   ext TEXT NOT NULL,   size Integer NOT NULL,   width Integer NOT NULL,   height Integer NOT NULL,   is_deleted Boolean NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (id) );

prompt: What is the average H5 index of researchers in each organization?
sql_statement: SELECT      "Organisation".name AS organization_name,     AVG("Researcher".h5_index) AS average_h5_index FROM      "Researcher" JOIN      "Organisation" ON "Researcher".org_id = "Organisation".org_id GROUP BY      "Organisation".name;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: How many publications have been authored by researchers from organizations with more than 100 employees?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT p.publication_id) AS publication_count FROM Publication p JOIN Authors a ON p.publication_id = a.publication_id JOIN Researcher r ON a.author_id = r.researcher_id JOIN Organisation o ON r.org_id = o.org_id WHERE o.domain > 100;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: List the top 5 most cited publications along with their publishers and the number of citations.
sql_statement: SELECT      P.title AS publication_title,     P.publisher,     SUM(C.citation_count) AS total_citations FROM      Publication P JOIN      Citations C ON P.publication_id = C.publication_id GROUP BY      P.publication_id, P.title, P.publisher ORDER BY      total_citations DESC LIMIT 5;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: Among researchers with an i10_index greater than 20, what percentage are affiliated with organizations based in .edu domains?
sql_statement: SELECT      CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN o.domain LIKE '%.edu' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) * 100 / COUNT(*) AS percentage_edu_domain FROM      Researcher r JOIN      Organisation o ON r.org_id = o.org_id WHERE      r.i10_index > 20;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: What is the average number of interests per researcher, grouped by H5 index range (0-10, 11-20, 21+)?
sql_statement: SELECT      CASE          WHEN h5_index BETWEEN 0 AND 10 THEN '0-10'         WHEN h5_index BETWEEN 11 AND 20 THEN '11-20'         ELSE '21+'     END AS h5_index_range,     COUNT(interest_id) / COUNT(DISTINCT researcher_id) AS average_interests_per_researcher FROM      Researcher LEFT JOIN      Interests ON Researcher.researcher_id = Interests.researcher_id GROUP BY      h5_index_range;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: For each organization, determine the total citations received by all its researchers' publications.
sql_statement: SELECT      o.name AS organisation_name,     SUM(c.citation_count) AS total_citations_received FROM      Organisation o JOIN      Researcher r ON o.org_id = r.org_id JOIN      Authors a ON r.researcher_id = a.author_id JOIN      Citations c ON a.publication_id = c.publication_id GROUP BY      o.name;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: Which interest has been pursued by the highest percentage of researchers in terms of their h5_index?
sql_statement: SELECT      i.interest,     (COUNT(CASE WHEN r.h5_index > 0 THEN r.researcher_id END) * 1.0 / COUNT(DISTINCT r.researcher_id)) AS percentage_with_h5_index FROM      Interests i JOIN      Researcher r ON i.researcher_id = r.researcher_id GROUP BY      i.interest ORDER BY      percentage_with_h5_index DESC LIMIT 1;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: What is the median number of citations for publications that have been cited at least once since 2018?
sql_statement: SELECT      ROUND(         AVG(citation_count),          4     ) AS median_citations FROM (     SELECT          citation_count     FROM          Citations     WHERE          year >= 2018 AND citation_count > 0     ORDER BY          citation_count ) AS subquery;
schema: CREATE TABLE Organisation (   org_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   domain Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Researcher (   researcher_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   org_id Int NOT NULL,   name Varchar NOT NULL,   h5_index Int NOT NULL,   h5_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   i10_index Int NOT NULL,   i10_index_ten Int NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (researcher_id),   FOREIGN KEY (org_id) REFERENCES Organisation (org_id) );  CREATE TABLE Interests (   interest_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   researcher_id Int NOT NULL,   interest Varchar NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (interest_id),   FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Publication (   publication_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   title Varchar NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   publisher Varchar NOT NULL,   citations Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (publication_id) );  CREATE TABLE Authors (   authorship_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   author_id Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (authorship_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id),   FOREIGN KEY (author_id) REFERENCES Researcher (researcher_id) );  CREATE TABLE Citations (   citation_id Int NOT NULL UNIQUE,   publication_id Int NOT NULL,   year Int NOT NULL,   citation_count Int NOT NULL,   PRIMARY KEY (citation_id),   FOREIGN KEY (publication_id) REFERENCES Publication (publication_id) );

prompt: Among organizations with more than 5 publications in the last 5 years, which one has the highest average citation count per publication?
sql_statement: SELECT      o.name AS organisation_name,     AVG(c.citation_count) AS average_citation_count FROM      Organisation o JOIN      Researcher r ON o.org_id = r.org_id JOIN      Authors a ON r.researcher_id = a.author_id JOIN      Publication p ON a.publication_id = p.publication_id JOIN      Citations c ON p.publication_id = c.publication_id WHERE      p.year >= YEAR(CURRENT_DATE) - 5 GROUP BY      o.org_id, o.name HAVING      COUNT(DISTINCT p.publication_id) > 5 ORDER BY      average_citation_count DESC LIMIT 1;

prompt: How many unique authors are there across all publications that received more than 100 citations?
sql_statement: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT T2.author_id) AS unique_author_count FROM Publication AS T1 JOIN Authors AS T2 ON T1.publication_id = T2.publication_id WHERE T1.citations > 100;
